description: From or akin to West Frisian ril (“rill; a narrow channel”), Dutch ril (“rill; gully; trench; watercourse”), German Low German Rille, Rill (“a small channel; brook; furrow”), German Rille (“a groove; furrow”).

entries.meaning: A very small brook; a streamlet; a creek, rivulet.

verbs.description: rill (third-person singular simple present rills, present participle rilling, simple past and past participle rilled)

entries.meaning: To trickle, pour, or run like a small stream.
examples: To where the listening uplands are;
To pause—then from his gurgling bill
And down the welkin, gushing free,
